There are four I really go for: “Can’t Buy Me Love”, “If I Fell”, “I Should Have Known Better "– a song with harmonica we feature during the opening train sequence – and Tell Me Why, a shuffle number that comes at the end of the film.

John Lennon had always dismissed his earlier songs of love and hate as just silly songs he whipped up, with no apparent meaning.

However Paul suspects they were derived from actual events in John’s life:

I think a lot of these songs like Tell Me Why may have been based in real experiences or affairs John was having or arguments with Cynthia or whatever, but it never occurred to us until later to put that slant on it all.
